title: Baked Fish Fillets Recipe
description: Learn how long to bake fish with this quick and easy recipe for a baked fish dinner of mackerel fillets coated with butter, lemon juice, and paprika.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Seafood Fish Baked Fish Fillets 4.6 (27) 21 Reviews 6 Photos Learn how long to bake fish with this great recipe that works well with any filleted fish. Cook time may vary depending on the type and thickness of fillets. Submitted by JAcob Griffin Updated on February 17, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or to taste 2 pounds mackerel fillets 1 teaspoon salt ⅛ teaspoon ground black pepper ¼ cup butter, melted 2 tablespoons lemon juice ⅛ teaspoon ground paprika Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking pan with vegetable oil. Place mackerel fillets in the baking pan; season with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix butter, lemon juice, and paprika together in a bowl. Pour over mackerel fillets. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 20 to 25 minutes. I Made It Print 79 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Baked Fish Fillets 01 of 06 Photo by  dotdash meredith food studios 02 of 06 Photo by  Aileen Lisette 09/07/2019 Very good, I did add a sprinkle of onion powder to the mix and I used almost a pound of flounder fillets because that's what I had on hand. Cooked in about 20 minutes at 375. Delightful and delicate taste. Delicious! 03 of 06 Photo by  Aileen Lisette 09/07/2019 Very good, I did add a sprinkle of onion powder to the mix and I used almost a pound of flounder fillets because that's what I had on hand. Cooked in about 20 minutes at 375. Delightful and delicate taste. Delicious! 04 of 06 Photo by  Gen Cherry 09/05/2019 05 of 06 Photo by  Thao Le 07/11/2017 06 of 06 Photo by  Bren 12/12/2016 We enjoyed this. I had haddock that was on the thiner side so it was ready in 12 minutes. Fairly basic recipe that could be adjusted to suite your tastes. name: JAcob Griffin
instructions: Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking pan with vegetable oil.;Place mackerel fillets in the baking pan; season with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Mix butter, lemon juice, and paprika together in a bowl. Pour over mackerel fillets. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 20 to 25 minutes.
